title: Tables and Fields
text: In an SQL query, when specifying fields to select from a table, they should be separated by a comma. This helps SQL identify each field accurately.

title: Understanding SQL Syntax
text: Ensure that each element of your query follows SQL syntax rules closely. This includes using commas properly, ordering clauses correctly, and always matching fields with commas.

title: Identify the Missing Element in the Query
text: Look at the list of fields after the SELECT statement. Can you see what might be missing between 'Street' and 'ZIP'?
